member.name: T:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor
member.summary: The color functions provided by DirectXMath.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.Equal(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Tests for the equality of two colors.
member.returns: Returns true if each of the components of the two colors are equal, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.NotEqual(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Tests to see whether two colors are unequal.
member.returns: Returns true if any component of C1 is different from the corresponding component of C2. Returns false otherwise.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.Greater(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Tests whether all the components of the first color are greater than the corresponding components in the second color.
member.returns: Returns true if every component of C1 is greater than the corresponding component in C2. Returns false otherwise.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.GreaterOrEqual(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Tests whether all the components of the first color are greater than or equal to the corresponding components of the second color.
member.returns: Returns true if every component of C1 is greater than or equal to the corresponding component in C2. Returns false otherwise.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.Less(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Tests whether all the components of the first color are less than the corresponding components of the second color.
member.returns: Returns true if every component of C1 is less than the corresponding component in C2. Returns false otherwise.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.LessOrEqual(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Tests whether all the components of the first color are less than or equal to the corresponding components of the second color.
member.returns: Returns true if every component of C1 is less than or equal to the corresponding component in C2. Returns false otherwise.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.IsNaN(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Tests to see whether any component of a color is not a number (NaN).
member.returns: Returns true if any components of C are NaN, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.IsInfinite(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Tests to see whether any of the components of a color are either positive or negative infinity.
member.returns: Returns true if any components of C are either positive or negative infinity. Returns false otherwise.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.Negative(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Determines the negative RGB color value of a color.
member.param: The color. Each of the components of C should be in the range 0.0f to 1.0f.
member.returns: The negative color. The w-component (alpha) is copied unmodified from the input vector.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.Modulate(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Blends two colors by multiplying corresponding components together.
member.returns: The color resulting from the modulation.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.AdjustSaturation(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,System.Single)
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation value of a color.
member.param: The color. Each of the components of C should be in the range 0.0f to 1.0f.

Saturation value. This parameter linearly interpolates between the color converted to gray-scale and the original color, C. If Saturation is 0.0f, the function returns the gray-scale color. If Saturation is 1.0f, the function returns the original color.
member.returns: The color resulting from the saturation adjustment.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.AdjustContrast(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,System.Single)
member.summary: Adjusts the contrast value of a color.
member.param: The color. Each of the components of C should be in the range 0.0f to 1.0f.

Contrast value. This parameter linearly interpolates between 50 percent gray and the color C. If this parameter is 0.0f, the returned color is 50 percent gray. If this parameter is 1.0f, the returned color is the original color.
member.returns: The color resulting from the contrast adjustment.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.RgbToHsl(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to HSL color values.
member.param: Color value to convert. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha. Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.returns: The converted color value. The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Luminance (L), and the W element is Alpha (a copy of the input's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.HslToRgb(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts HSL color values to RGB color values.
member.param: Color value to convert. The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Luminance (L), and the W element is Alpha. Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.returns: The converted color value. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha (a copy of hsl.w) . Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.RgbToHsv(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to HSV color values.
member.param: Color value to convert. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha. Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.returns: The converted color value. The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Value (V), and the W element is Alpha (a copy of rgb.w). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.HsvToRgb(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts HSV color values to RGB color values.
member.param: Color value to convert. The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Value (V), and the W element is Alpha. Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.returns: The converted color value. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha (a copy of hsv.w) . Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.RgbToYuv(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to YUV color values.
member.param: Color value to convert. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha. Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.returns: The converted color value in Luma-Chrominance (YUV) aka YCbCr. The X element contains Luma (Y, 0.0 to 1.0), the Y element contains Blue-difference chroma (-0.5 to 0.5), the Z element contains the Red-difference chroma (-0.5 to 0.5), and the W element contains the Alpha (a copy of rgb.w).

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.YuvToRgb(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts YUV color values to RGB color values.
member.param: Color value to convert in Luma-Chrominance (YUV) aka YCbCr. The X element contains Luma (Y, 0.0 to 1.0), the Y element contains Blue-difference chroma (U, -0.5 to 0.5), the Z element contains the Red-difference chroma (V, -0.5 to 0.5), and the W element contains the Alpha (0.0 to 1.0).
member.returns: The converted color value. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha (a copy of yuv.w). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.RgbToYuvHD(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to YUV HD color values.
member.param: Color value to convert. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha. Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.returns: The converted color value in Luma-Chrominance (YUV) aka YCbCr. The X element contains Luma (Y, 0.0 to 1.0), the Y element contains Blue-difference chroma (-0.5 to 0.5), the Z element contains the Red-difference chroma (-0.5 to 0.5), and the W element contains the Alpha (a copy of rgb.w).

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.YuvToRgbHD(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts YUV color values to RGB HD color values.
member.param: Color value to convert in Luma-Chrominance (YUV) aka YCbCr. The X element contains Luma (Y, 0.0 to 1.0), the Y element contains Blue-difference chroma (U, -0.5 to 0.5), the Z element contains the Red-difference chroma (V, -0.5 to 0.5), and the W element contains the Alpha (0.0 to 1.0).
member.returns: The converted color value. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha (a copy of yuv.w). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.RgbToXyz(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to XYZ color values.
member.param: Color value to convert. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha. Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.returns: The converted color value with the trisimulus values of X, Y, and Z in the corresponding element, and the W element with Alpha (a copy of rgb.w). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.XyzToRgb(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts XYZ color values to RGB color values.
member.param: Color value to convert with the trisimulus values of X, Y, and Z in the corresponding element, and the W element with Alpha. Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.returns: The converted color value. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha (a copy of xyz.w). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.XyzToSrgb(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts XYZ color values to SRGB color values.
member.param: Color value to convert with the trisimulus values of X, Y, and Z in the corresponding element, and the W element with Alpha. Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.returns: The converted color value. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha (a copy of xyz.w). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0 in the linear sRGB colorspace.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.SrgbToXyz(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts SRGB color values to XYZ color values.
member.param: Color value to convert. X element is Red, Y element is Green, Z element is Blue, and W element is Alpha. Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0 and is in the linear sRGB colorspace.
member.returns: The converted color value with the trisimulus values of X, Y, and Z in the corresponding element, and the W element with Alpha (a copy of rgb.w). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.RgbToSrgb(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts an RGB color vector to sRGB.
member.returns: The converted sRGBA color vector. The x element is red, the y element is green, the z element is blue, and the w element is the alpha value (which is a copy of rgb.w). Each element value has a range of 0.0 to 1.0 in the sRGB colorspace.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMColor.SrgbToRgb(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Converts an sRGB color vector to RGB.
member.returns: The converted RGBA color vector. The x element is red, the y element is green, the z element is blue, and the w element is the alpha value (which is a copy of srgb.w). Each element value has a range of 0.0 to 1.0 in the RGB colorspace.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMMath.FresnelTerm(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector)
member.summary: Calculates the Fresnel term for unpolarized light.

member.summary: Creates a vector, each of whose components is either 0.0f or 1.0f.
member.param: This parameter must be a number (an immediate value, either 0 or 1) and not a variable. If C0 is 0, the x-component of the returned vector will be 0.0f. Otherwise, the x-component will be 1.0f.
This parameter must be a number (an immediate value, either 0 or 1) and not a variable. If C1 is 0, the y-component of the returned vector will be 0.0f. Otherwise, the y-component will be 1.0f.
This parameter must be a number (an immediate value, either 0 or 1) and not a variable. If C2 is 0, the z-component of the returned vector will be 0.0f. Otherwise, the z-component will be 1.0f.
This parameter must be a number (an immediate value, either 0 or 1) and not a variable. If C3 is 0, the w-component of the returned vector will be 0.0f. Otherwise, the w-component will be 1.0f.
member.returns: Returns a vector, each of whose components is either 0.0f or 1.0f.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector.Insert(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Rotates a vector left by a given number of 32-bit components and insert selected elements of that result into another vector.
member.param: Number of 32-bit components by which to rotate VS left.
Either 0 or 1. If one, the x-component of the rotated vector will be inserted into the corresponding component of VD. Otherwise, the x-component of VD is left alone.
Either 0 or 1. If one, the y-component of the rotated vector will be inserted into the corresponding component of VD. Otherwise, the y-component of VD is left alone.
Either 0 or 1. If one, the z-component of the rotated vector will be inserted into the corresponding component of VD. Otherwise, the z-component of VD is left alone.
Either 0 or 1. If one, the w-component of the rotated vector will be inserted into the corresponding component of VD. Otherwise, the w-component of VD is left alone.
member.returns: Returns the vector that results from the rotation and insertion.

member.name: M:JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector3.Project(JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMVector,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMMatrix,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMMatrix,JeremyAnsel.DirectX.DXMath.XMMatrix)
member.summary: Project a 3D vector from object space into screen space.
member.param: The vector in object space that will be projected into screen space.
Pixel coordinate of the upper-left corner of the viewport. Unless you want to render to a subset of the surface, this parameter can be set to 0.
Pixel coordinate of the upper-left corner of the viewport on the render-target surface. Unless you want to render to a subset of the surface, this parameter can be set to 0.
Width dimension of the clip volume, in pixels. Unless you are rendering only to a subset of the surface, this parameter should be set to the width dimension of the render-target surface.
Height dimension of the clip volume, in pixels. Unless you are rendering only to a subset of the surface, this parameter should be set to the height dimension of the render-target surface.

Together with ViewportMaxZ, value describing the range of depth values into which a scene is to be rendered, the minimum and maximum values of the clip volume. Most applications set this value to 0.0f. Clipping is performed after applying the projection matrix.

Together with MinZ, value describing the range of depth values into which a scene is to be rendered, the minimum and maximum values of the clip volume. Most applications set this value to 1.0f. Clipping is performed after applying the projection matrix.
member.returns: Returns a vector in screen space.

Width dimension of the clip volume, in pixels. Unless you are rendering only to a subset of the surface, this parameter should be set to the width dimension of the render-target surface.
Height dimension of the clip volume, in pixels. Unless you are rendering only to a subset of the surface, this parameter should be set to the height dimension of the render-target surface.

Together with ViewportMaxZ, value describing the range of depth values into which a scene is to be rendered, the minimum and maximum values of the clip volume. Most applications set this value to 0.0f. Clipping is performed after applying the projection matrix.

Together with MinZ, value describing the range of depth values into which a scene is to be rendered, the minimum and maximum values of the clip volume. Most applications set this value to 1.0f. Clipping is performed after applying the projection matrix.
member.returns: Returns a vector in object space.
